Message.Title: NTWK $5.3 UP 33c....BREAKING OUT!! NEW TARGET $16...NEW CLOUD DIVISION ANNOUNCEMENT IS HUGE!!..September 6, 2012. NTWK created a new division, NetSolCloudVM, that will offer infrastructure-as-a-service (IaaS), initially targeting the North American market. Set to launch in September as a division of NetSol North America, NetSolCloudVM will provide clients with IT infrastructure on a monthly tiered subscription basis
Message.Msg: NTWK'S OTHER CLOUD DIVISION VROOZI ALREADY EXPLODED IN REVENUES IN Q4 2012.. ACQUISITION CANDIDATE GUIDED FOR $1/SHARE NET INCOME ON 40% REVENUE GROWTH FOR 2013....................3M SHARE FLOAT......AFTER EARNINGS PROFIT TAKING OVER.....MAGNIFICENT CHART In its updated public cloud forecast in June, Gartner estimated that IaaS was the fastest growing cloud segment with a projected GAGR of 41.7%, and exceeding a $20 billion global market by 2016. "We made a calculated decision to enter this growing market given our years of experience as a software developer, the minimal investment required, and the revenue potential given just the breadth of our current relationships," said Najeeb Ghauri, chairman and CEO of NetSol. "I am fully confident in our highly capable team, reinforced by our talented group of IT professionals, to scale the business quickly and capture a portion of this burgeoning industry, creating an additional revenue driver and further diversifying our revenue mix by geography." "What we are offering, in essence, is private cloud performance at an elastic cloud price -- giving potential customers in our target market segment the performance, flexibility, reliability, and a no-nonsense fixed pricing model that they have long desired," added Imran Haider, COO of NetSol North America and head of NetSolCloudVM. "As a growing software company ourselves, we have critical insights into the efficiency and productivity needs of NetSolCloudVM's target customer base and look forward to unveiling our new services in the coming months." TARGET $10+ .......5 FWD P/E - WITH 30% 2013 GROWTH AND $1/SHARE NET INCOME IN 2013 NetSol Technologies Reported RECORD Fiscal Fourth Quarter and Year-End Results - 9/4/2012 - Fourth Quarter 2012 Revenue Surges to an all-time quarterly record of $14.3 Million on Increased License Revenues and associated maintenance and service agreements going forward - Fourth Quarter 2012 Earnings Advance Significantly to $0.25 per Diluted Share - Full Year 2012 revenues a record $38M - Full Year 2012 Earnings of $0.39/share - Company Expects Record Fiscal 2013 Annual Revenue Growing over 30% to $46 million to $49 million, With Earnings per Diluted Share Advancing to $0.80 to $1.00 - Per the CC, Company anticipates doubling revenues and net income by 2015 NTWK HIGHLIGHTS: - Only 3 million share float - Fast growing profitable US-based global cloud and license-based software company with 8 offices worldwide (US, China, Australia, UK, Pakistan, Singapore, Thailand, Saudi Arabia) â€“ - Trading at 5 PE and 1 times sales â€“ This is about 25% of sector average - Revenues are increasing at double digit rates, - Guidance calls for 30% revenue growth in 2013 - 3 consecutive quarters of profitability, - Guidance calls for $1/share net income in 2013!!! - Global alliances with Mercedes Benz and SANY Corp of China. - No. 1 in China and the APAC region in its niche market of leasing and financing software - Itâ€™s Vroozi Division is a fast growing Cloud Computing Play with strong relations with SAP, ORCL, MSFT. - Vrooziâ€™s SAP-approved smartOCI procurement search catalog software built on SaaS is being adopted rapidly. Revenues exploded in 4Q 2012 and are expected to multiply in 2013 and a big reason for the 30%+ 2013 projected revenue increase - Vroozi has been created as independent entity to potentially IPO it or sell it to a cloud-acquiring giant like SAP and others - Strong balance sheet with $1/share Cash - With every license they sell a lucrative 5-year service and maintenance agreement building strong recurrent revenues - Huge and consistent insider buying. Insiders bought over 5% of the outstanding shares since 2010 - Strong institutional investor support grew to almost 20% from 11% last year - NTWK has over 50 Fortune 100 loyal customers. Never lost a customer. None of the customers is over 5% of the total revenues - partial customer list: CitiGroup, Mercedes Benz, Santander, BMW, Volvo, Ford, GE Capital, Cisco Capital, Paribas, GMAC, Toyota, Nissan, Hyundai, BYD, SANY Corp. China, etc.

Message.Title: Lotto Mania
Message.Msg: The stock market is 99% emotional near term. Problem right now is that the government is printing $ to pump up stocks. This will stop in the future due to loss of confidence in the scam, and the bubble stocks will collapse because there is no real earning or dividend to support current stock value. Right now, Scamazon is acting like a lottery ticket. Millions of buyers but only one winner...the few who sold at the top. No stock in the history of the market can sustain absurd valuation. They all collapse when reality does not meet expectation. Traders and the average investors are conditioned to act to make them feel good "right now", even though 99% of these people are wrong in the long term. Successful people filter out these short term noises and stay focused on the big picture. This is a Marathon. Those with a KISS steady approach will always come out on top with less stress

Message.Title: Ebook settlement and Ebook pricing
Message.Msg: Last weeks Kindle announcements, which so excited the Amazon fans, included a very explicit statement from Jeffy that he does not want to make money on the Kindle devices themselves but on the usage of the devices (does anyone want to tell me I heard this incorrectly). Last week in a legal finding, Judge Denise Cotes accepted the Ebook settlement with 3 publishers, which basically says that Amazon can go back to selling Ebooks at below cost. Jeff loves to go around telling everyone that they deserve low-cost Ebooks and I think he will have a customer revolt on his hands if he now tries to sell Ebooks for more the $9.99. I'm a little slow in understanding the business plan on this one. Where are the down-the-road earnings going to come from on the use of the Kindle's?

Message.Title: Rob Enderle is a complete #$%$..
Message.Msg: Even worse than Mark Mahaney. As stupid as they come. Just wrote an article how Amazon is going to crush Apple because Apple cannot match Amazon's prices, therefore AMZN will dominate the tablet market. A few points. 1) Apple has superior hardware unit economics. As the largest purchaser of electronic components in the world, it has pricing power with all suppliers. It also has superior marketing/promotion economics as it reaches a wider audience than Amazon with fewer SKUs to promote. 2) All of the "spin" on the ebook ruling is that it is great for Amazon because it can now cut prices. But, AMAZON'S MODEL IS NOW ENTIRELY DEPENDENT UPON REALIZING ITS PROFITS FROM CONTENT. The irony is priceless. Apple and Google can simply undercut Amazon's content pricing across the board by 10% and Amazon is hosed. The DOJ will have NO CASE against them because it forced the issue in the first place. It is a business model competition and one that Apple and Google will win by getting hardware costs relatively close to Amazon and then undercutting on content (plus, they should find some infringing IP and file a suit to boot). Apple's Pandora like play is just the beginning. Expect it and Google to launch a NFLX like service as well. When it is all said and done, Amazon will find that it can extract very little in the way of rents on digital content. And it will have burned insane cash on the experiment... The point is that Apple and Google have the cash to take the fight to Amazon on kick it in the #$%$ And, now that this is just good old business model competition that Amazon started, no one will be able to protect it...

Topic.Title: Rob Enderle is a complete #$%$..

Message.Msg: Rob and most of the analyst community seems to be living in the past on this issue. Now, Apple and Google can attack Amazon's cash generating machine with impunity. Amazon sells hardware at a loss. They can sell content at cost, ensuring near zero content profit contribution for Amazon. How long will Amazon soar in that environment??? It's going to create a very interesting survival challenge over the next 2 years since it has exploding overhead/fixed costs and personnel costs (and when the stock stops going up, other compensation will have to increase to retain people since the valuation scam will no longer create wealth for top performing employees). The bottom line is whatever price Amazon can offer on content, Apple and Google can offer a better one because that it not where THEY make they majority of their money (and they generate 10's of billions in profits a year that they can afford to deploy strategically to blunt Amazon's consumer value proposition).
